oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jerusalem MB: church and sign
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of Jerusalem Missionary Baptist Church. The gable-fronted, frame church features a gable-roofed vestibule, modern double doors, and four bays of windows on its main section. A school wing is attached to the rear of the building. A gravel lot sits in front of the building. The church sign's lettering reads, "Jerusalem M.B. Church, Order of Worship: Sunday School, 10:00 AM; Morning Worship, 11:15 AM, Bible Study, Tuesday Night 6:30 PM; Rev. Lee A. Turner."
Jerusalem Missionary Baptist Church is a rural African American church located in Bells, Tennessee. The current building dates to 1920. At the time of fieldwork, Reverend Lee Turner served as pastor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Baptist church buildings
